Narrative Viz Playbook

The playbook is my way to share how to tell visual stories with data by way of clear and thoughtfully organized lessons.

I am offering them as "plays" that have worked for me. I trust your judgement to decide which approaches and tools might work better for you.

Comming Soon! I will be posting a lesson every couple of weeks starting in Sept 2013.

This is a draft outline and may change as the playbook is written.

Please do subscribe to get informed when the lessons are posted.

1. Art of Observation

1.01 Starting with Structure and Synthesis: Where do we start from? Let us start by putting some structure around our data visualizations

1.02 Learning the Basic Principle: Let us understand the ground rules for designing a good visualization. We need to know the rules to break it.

1.03 Making Tables & Graph: It is surprising how often we represent data using different types of table and graphs. Do you know when to use which one?

1.04 Visualizing Text: We know that gaining insight from qualitative text is hard. However, thinking of ways to visualize text is even harder. Can we make it easy?

1.05 Adding Interactivity: We mostly stick to static visuals like in a text book. Why aren't data visualizations interactive and playful?

2. Art of Listening

2.01 Making the Story Stick: We have all heard stories right from our childhood. So what special ingredients do stories need to capture our attention?

2.02 Developing your Story Spine: How do we translate the traditional story elements into our data-driven story? One way is to use the 'Story Spine' Structure

2.03 Telling Stories with Data: How do we bring this together? Let's map the elements of doing good storytelling and data visualisation in sync.

2.04 Presenting with Impact: We have all watched presentators that have captured the imagination of the audience. How do we ensure we have presence and impact when we are telling your data-stories?
